titleInfo.title: USA v. Degarmo
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ON ISSUES IN PRETRIAL HEARING. The defendant moved that witnesses be sequestered. The motion is granted without objection. The defendant moved in limine that no mention of the defendant's imprisonment be made during voir dire examination, opening statements, or during the government's case-in-chief. There was no objection and the motion is granted. The defendant's counsel said that it has been decided that the defendant will not testify. The defendant asks that an instruction be given that the defendant has a right not to testify. That motion is granted. On the defendant's Motion to Strike, filing 88, ruling is reserved; the government is to present to opposing counsel and the presiding judge authorities by the opening of the trial as to whether evidence of at least 5 kilograms of a mixture or substance containing a detectable amount of methamphetamine, 9 mm ammunition by the defendant when he was a felon, possession of a dangerous weapon, including firearms, and his role in the conspiracy are factual matters that need to be determined by the jury, whether evidence of them is admissible, and whether they are properly pleaded in the second superseding indictment. The defendant's Motion to Dismiss on Speedy Trial Grounds 98, accompanied by Defendant's Exhibit 100, is denied as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1). Signed by Judge Warren K. Urbom on 5/9/2005. (EJL )abeyance 88 Motion to Strike as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1); denying 98 Motion to Dismiss Criminal Case as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1) Signed by Judge Warren K. Urbom on 5/9/2005. (EJL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER ON ISSUES IN PRETRIAL HEARING. The defendant moved that witnesses be sequestered. The motion is granted without objection. The defendant moved in limine that no mention of the defendant's imprisonment be made during voir dire examination, opening statements, or during the government's case-in-chief. There was no objection and the motion is granted. The defendant's counsel said that it has been decided that the defendant will not testify. The defendant asks that an instruction be given that the defendant has a right not to testify. That motion is granted. On the defendant's Motion to Strike, filing 88, ruling is reserved; the government is to present to opposing counsel and the presiding judge authorities by the opening of the trial as to whether evidence of at least 5 kilograms of a mixture or substance containing a detectable amount of methamphetamine, 9 mm ammunition by the defendant when he was a felon, possession of a dangerous weapon, including firearms, and his role in the conspiracy are factual matters that need to be determined by the jury, whether evidence of them is admissible, and whether they are properly pleaded in the second superseding indictment. The defendant's Motion to Dismiss on Speedy Trial Grounds 98, accompanied by Defendant's Exhibit 100, is denied as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1). Signed by Judge Warren K. Urbom on 5/9/2005. (EJL )abeyance 88 Motion to Strike as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1); denying 98 Motion to Dismiss Criminal Case as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1) Signed by Judge Warren K. Urbom on 5/9/2005. (EJL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Degarmo
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant(s) Timothy S. Degarmo. An evidentiary hearing is needed and will be had immediately preceding the sentencing. The court tentatively finds the Presentence Investigation Report to be accurate, except for those paragraphs to which objection by the defendant has been made. Objections to these tentative findings may be made at the evidentiary hearing, but no evidence relating to them shall be received and none has been requested. No persons have been identified as expected to be called to testify. Identification is required by the Order on Sentencing Schedule dated May 20, 2005, filing 129. Signed by Judge Warren K. Urbom on 8/8/2005. (EJL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Degarmo
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to defendant Timothy S. Degarmo (1): Defendant was found guilty by a jury to Count I of the Second Superseding Indictment and is therefore sentenced to be committed to the custody of the U.S. Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of 300 months, followed by 5 years of Supervised Release with special conditions and ordered to pay a $100.00 Special Assessment. Count 2ss, is DISMISSED on motion of the government as to this defendant only. Criminal Case Terminated. Signed by Judge Warren K. Urbom on 8/16/2005, sentence imposed on 8/15/2005. (4 CC to USM) (JAR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

Count 2ss, is DISMISSED on motion of the government as to this defendant only. Criminal Case Terminated. Signed by Judge Warren K. Urbom on 8/16/2005, sentence imposed on 8/15/2005. (4 CC to USM) (JAR)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Degarmo
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding 175 Motion to Vacate (2255) as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1). IT IS ORDERED that the defendant is entitled to an evidentiary hearing on the following claims: 1) the defendant was the subject of prosecutorial vindictiveness, and 2) defense counsel's failure to raise a prosecutorial vindictiveness claim amounted to ineffective assistance of counsel. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in all other respects, the defendant's motion to vacate, set aside, or correct his sentence pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 2255, filing 175, and his motion for an evidentiary hearing, filing 176, are denied. The request for counsel contained in filing 177, is granted and the Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska is appointed to represent the above-named plaintiff in this matter. Ordered by Senior District Judge Warren K. Urbom. (Copy to pro se party and Public Defender)(JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER regarding 175 Motion to Vacate (2255) as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1). IT IS ORDERED that the defendant is entitled to an evidentiary hearing on the following claims: 1) the defendant was the subject of prosecutorial vindictiveness, and 2) defense counsel's failure to raise a prosecutorial vindictiveness claim amounted to ineffective assistance of counsel. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in all other respects, the defendant's motion to vacate, set aside, or correct his sentence pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 2255, filing 175, and his motion for an evidentiary hearing, filing 176, are denied. The request for counsel contained in filing 177, is granted and the Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska is appointed to represent the above-named plaintiff in this matter. Ordered by Senior District Judge Warren K. Urbom. (Copy to pro se party and Public Defender)(JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Degarmo
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ON MOTION TO CONTINUE MOTION TO VACATE SENTENCE DUE TO PROSECUTORIAL MISCONDUCT - The Motion to Continue Motion to Vacate Sentence Due to Prosecutorial Misconduct, filing 192, is granted. The hearing on the claims that (1) the defendant was the subject of prosecutorial vindictiveness and (2) that the defense counsel's failure to raise a prosecutorial vindictiveness claim amounted to ineffective assistance of counsel shall be continued until March 11, 2008, at 10:00 a..m. The U.S. Marshal shall have the defendant present for the hearing as to Timothy S. Degarmo (1). Ordered by Senior Judge Warren K. Urbom. (1 Certified copy to USM)( GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Degarmo
titleInfo.subTitle: Certificate of Appealability regarding Notice of Appeal to USCA, 200 as to defendant Timothy S. Degarmo. A certificate of appealability is issued on the defendants claims that he was the subject of prosecutorial vindictiveness and that his trial counsel provided constitutionally ineffective assistance due to his failure to raise the issue of prosecutorial vindictiveness. The defendant has made a substantial showing of the denial of a constitutional right. Ordered by Senior Judge Warren K. Urbom. (JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: Certificate of Appealability regarding Notice of Appeal to USCA, 200 as to defendant Timothy S. Degarmo. titleInfo.title: USA v. Degarmo
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER TO WITHDRAW EXHIBITS OR TO SHOW CAUSE WHY EXHIBITS SHOULD NOT BE DESTROYED as to defendant Timothy S. Degarmo. Pursuant to NECivR 79.1(f) or NECrimR 55.1(g), counsel for parties shall either 1) withdraw the following exhibits previously submitted in this matter within 14 calendar days of the date of this order, or 2) show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed: All exhibits from evidentiary hearing held 3/11/2008. If counsel fails to withdraw these exhibits as directed or to show cause why the exhibits should not be destroyed, the clerk's office is directed to destroy the listed exhibits without further notice to the parties or order from the court. (Exhibit Deadline set for 1/24/2012.) Ordered by Senior Judge Warren K. Urbom. (TEL)
